title: Codes and defintions
text: Norwegian Directorate Fisheries (FDir) Institute Marine Research (IMR) use abbreviations, codes definitions data. document contains tables definition files within RstoxUtils package.

title: Codes and defintions
text: cruiseSeriesList can used connect cruises Biotic data respective cruise series. BioticExplorerServer package automatically allowing database search using cruise series. can update list prepareCruiseSeriesList() function connected IMR intranet.
code: cruiseSeriesList #>       cruiseseriescode     cruise    platformname startyear #>                  <num>     <char>          <char>     <num> #>    1:                1    2004204     Johan Hjort      2004 #>    2:                1    2005105        G.O.Sars      2005 #>    3:                1    2006104        G.O.Sars      2006 #>    4:                1    2007845            Eros      2007 #>    5:                1    2008809          Gardar      2008 #>   ---                                                       #> 1217:                9    2015101        G.O.Sars      2015 #> 1218:                9    2016101        G.O.Sars      2016 #> 1219:                9    2017850 Cefas Endeavour      2017 #> 1220:                9    2018102        G.O.Sars      2018 #> 1221:                9 2024001002        G.O.Sars      2024 #>                                                                                  name #>                                                                                <char> #>    1: Atlantic Ocean West of British Isles INT blue whiting spawning survey in spring #>    2: Atlantic Ocean West of British Isles INT blue whiting spawning survey in spring #>    3: Atlantic Ocean West of British Isles INT blue whiting spawning survey in spring #>    4: Atlantic Ocean West of British Isles INT blue whiting spawning survey in spring #>    5: Atlantic Ocean West of British Isles INT blue whiting spawning survey in spring #>   ---                                                                                 #> 1217:                                       North Sea International IBTS cruise in Q1 #> 1218:                                       North Sea International IBTS cruise in Q1 #> 1219:                                       North Sea International IBTS cruise in Q1 #> 1220:                                       North Sea International IBTS cruise in Q1 #> 1221:                                       North Sea International IBTS cruise in Q1

title: Codes and defintions

Other #>   2:    100          Sikteskive          Other #>   3:   1000 Innsamling av vann. Water samplers #>   4:   1100   Vannhenter uspes. Water samplers #>   5:   1105   Rutler Vannhenter Water samplers #>  ---                                           #> 703:   8410      Scanmar uspes.          Other #> 704:   8411     Dekksenhet 0404          Other #> 705:   8412     Dekksenhet 4004          Other #> 706:   8413     Dekksenhet 4016          Other #> 707:   9000      Redskapsforsøk          Other #>                                                                                                                 description #>                                                                                                                      <char> #>   1:                                                                                                 Visuelle observasjoner #>   2:                                                                                                          Uspesifisert. #>   3:                                                                                       Redskaper for innsamling av vann #>   4:                                                                                                          Uspesifisert. #>   5:                                                                                             2.5 liter plastvannhenter. #>  ---                                                                                                                        #> 703:                                                                                                          Uspesifisert. #> 704:                                                           Dekksenhet  404. Sensorer: dybde, avstand, hoyde, hastighet. #> 705:                                          Dekksenhet 4004. Sensorer: dybde, avstand, hoyde, hastighet, minitransponder. #> 706:                                          Dekksenhet 4016. Sensorer: dybde, avstand, hoyde, hastighet, minitransponder. #> 707: Redskapsforsøk. Har kode 8000 i SPD-formatet. Kodene 9000-9999 blir reservert for redskapsforsøk. Listen blir utvidet.

title: Download and Visualize ERS Data
text: Directorate Fisheries Norway (FDir) collects distributes data exact positions times commercial fishing events Norwegian fleet vessels >15 m. data, referred ERS (Electronic Registration System), available FDir website. Currently, data available Norwegian compressed large, non-searchable zip files. downloadERS() extractERS() functions facilitate efficient handling datasets.

title: Download and Visualize ERS Data
text: downloadERS function can used download .zip files listed webpage. Specify dest argument location sufficient storage capacity: example, years 2011, 2018, 2025 used conserve space. However, may omit years argument download available data 2011 onward.
code: downloadERS(dest = "~Documents/Fisheries data/FDIR ERS data",             years = c(2011, 2018, 2025))

title: Download and Visualize ERS Data
text: downloading, use extractERS function read data: data can now visualized used analysis: Figure 1: Spatial distribution total beaked redfish catches Norwegian fleet (>15 m) based ERS data. Facets represent different years. color scale, indicating aggregated total catches tons, square-root transformed. Figure 2: Beaked redfish catches gear type year based ERS data Norwegian fleet (>15 m). Figure 3: Spatial distribution beaked redfish catches bottom pelagic trawls within Northeast Arctic (ICES areas 1 2) stock, based ERS data Norwegian fleet (>15 m). Data aggregated across 2011, 2018, 2025
code:
ers_example_data <-    extractERS(path = "~Documents/Fisheries data/FDIR ERS data",              species = "snabeluer") pp <- ggOceanMaps::basemap(   ers_example_data, bathy.style = "contour_grey", base_size = 12) +   stat_summary_hex(     data = ers_example_data %>%       ggOceanMaps:: transform_coord(bind = TRUE),     aes(x = lon.proj, y = lat.proj, z = weight/1e3), bins = 30,     fun = "sum") +   scale_fill_distiller(     palette = "Spectral", na.value = "grey", limits = c(0, NA),     trans = "sqrt")  +   facet_wrap(~year, ncol = 1) +    labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, fill = "Catch (t)") +    theme(     legend.box.margin = margin(0, 0, 10, 0),     legend.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent", color = NA),     legend.box.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent", color = NA))  reorder_layers(pp) ers_example_data %>%    mutate(gear = case_when(     grepl("Bunntr|Udefinert tr|Snurrevad", gear) ~ "Bottom
trawls",     grepl("Reketr", gear) ~ "Shrimp
trawls",     grepl("Flytetr", gear) ~ "Pelagic
trawls",     grepl("Garn", gearGroup) ~ "Gillnets",     grepl("Krokredskap", gearGroup) ~ "Hooks",     .default = "Other"   )) %>%    group_by(year, gear) %>%    reframe(value = sum(weight)/1e3) %>%    group_by(gear) %>%    mutate(total = sum(value)) %>%    arrange(-total) %>%    mutate(gear = factor(gear, levels = unique(.$gear))) %>%    ggplot(aes(x = gear, y = value)) +   geom_col() +   facet_wrap(~ year) +   labs(x = "Gear category", y = "Catch (t)") +   theme_bw(base_size = 12) x <- ers_example_data %>%    filter(grepl("Bunntr|Udefinert tr|Snurrevad|Reketr|Flytetr", gear)) %>%    filter(grepl("27_2_|27_1_", ICESArea)) %>%    mutate(gear = case_when(     grepl("Flytetr", gear) ~ "Pelagic trawls",     .default = "Bottom trawls"   ))  ggOceanMaps::basemap(x, base_size = 12, bathy.style = "contour_grey") +   ggspatial::geom_spatial_point(     data = x %>%        mutate(weight = weight/1e3),     aes(x = lon, y = lat, size = weight),     color = "red", shape = 21, alpha = 0.5, stroke = LS(1)) +   scale_size_area(     max_size = 12,     breaks = c(1,5,10,20,40,60.80)     ) +   labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, size = "Catch (t)") +    facet_wrap(~gear) +    guides(size = guide_legend(nrow = 1)) +   theme(legend.position = "bottom",         legend.box.margin = margin(0, 0, 10, 0),         legend.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent", color = NA),         legend.box.background = element_rect(fill = "transparent", color = NA))

title: Download and Visualize ERS Data
text: ERS data vessels <15 m (elFangstdagbok_detaljert) also available IMR servers. datasets distributed .psv format. can use extractLogbook function access . Please note function updated since 2021 may require development. data confidential require special access folder server located. need access (work IMR), take contact data people group. access, know data located. path argument point folder interest server (elFangstdagbok_detaljert data). path can defined Mac (Linux) path = "/Volumes/.../elFangstdagbok_detaljert" path = Q:/.../elFangstdagbok_detaljert Windows, ... represents entire folder path shown . can copy folder location path clip-board past extractLogbook() function. Remember use quotes (.e. " "). function slow especially Tromsø (prepare 30 min 1 h). filters species logbook data based codes listed table . example, Atlantic halibut can extracted follows: : species name returned Norwegian, English Latin depending language argument.
code: extractLogbook(path, species = "HAL") extractLogbook(path, species = 2311) # Excluding farmed fish

title: Download and Visualize Landings Data
text: Landings Norwegian commercial fisheries delivered registered landing facilities, include fish processing plants receiving stations. landings must documented sales note (sluttseddel), records detailed information catch, including species composition, quantity, landing location, fishing area. sales notes constitute primary data source official catch statistics extensively used fisheries management stock assessments Norway. Since general landing obligation Norway, terms ‘landings’ ‘catches’ used interchangeably even though unrecorded disgards might occur. data distributed .zip archives via Norwegian Directorate Fisheries (FDir) website, also accessible IMR API intranet. API enables searching filtering without downloading entire dataset. downloadLandings() function retrieves sales note data IMR API period 2005 onward, older data available Excel files IMR servers can accessed using readSluttseddelXLS() function. downloadLandings() function require connection IMR intranet, readSluttseddelXLS() dataDir can defined access data anywhere (example hard disk copied data server).

what: Download sales note data from 2005 onward
title: Download and Visualize Landings Data
text: downloadLandings() can used download sales note data utilizing IMR API containing data 2005. Specify species name Norwegian (see FDIRcodes$speciesCodes Table 1 Codes definitions vignette) years (want download data). example, ’ll download sales note data beaked redfish (Sebastes mentella). function returns summary data default picks relevant columns sales note list calculate landings. reference, summary simple dplyr expression: vignette delve deeper structure sales notes. download finished, take summary element sales note list analysis:
code: lnd <- downloadLandings("Snabeluer") sales_notes$Produkt %>%   dplyr::select(     "Fangst\u00e5r", "SisteFangstdato", "Redskap_kode", "Hovedomr\u00e5de_kode",     "Lokasjon_kode", "Fart\u00f8ynasjonalitet_kode", "Rundvekt") %>%   stats::setNames(c("year", "date", "gear_id", "main_area", "sub_area",                     "nation", "weight")) %>%   dplyr::mutate(date = as.Date(date, format = "%d.%m.%Y")) %>%   dplyr::filter(!is.na(weight) & weight > 0) %>%   dplyr::mutate(month = lubridate::month(.$date), .before = "date") %>%   dplyr::mutate_at(     dplyr::vars(main_area, sub_area, gear_id), as.integer) salesnote_example_data <- lnd$summary

title: Download and Visualize Landings Data
text: figures package author uses assessment reports. Please, feel free reuse modify. Thank author, :) Landings nation gear (Figure 1): Figure 1: Average annual beaked redfish catches delivered Norwegian landing facilities nation () catches reported gear (B). Error bars indicate standard deviations among years. Catches kilotons shown left y-axis right y-axis indicates percentage total average landings. Geographic distribution landings (Figure 2). Note vessels tend fish outside Norwegian waters still deliver fish Norwegian landing facilities. landings must filtered assessment specific region. Figure 2: Spatial distribution beaked redfish landed Norwegian harbors year. important figure, annual landings Norwegian vessels assessment area, international data accessed ICES (Figure 3). According package author, main areas (hovedområde) c(0:7, 10:18, 20:27, 30, 34:39, 50) roughly correspond ICES areas 1 2 according package author. Please provide feedback, correspondence can improved. Figure 3: Annual beaked redfish landings Norwegian fleet within ICES areas 1 2 according sales note data.
code: pnd <- salesnote_example_data %>%    group_by(nation, year) %>%    reframe(value = sum(weight)/1e6) %>%   group_by(nation) %>%    reframe(mean = mean(value), sd = sd(value)) %>%   tidyr::replace_na(list(sd = 0)) %>%    arrange(-mean) %>%    mutate(nation = factor(nation, levels = nation))   pn <- pnd %>%    ggplot(aes(x = nation, y = mean, ymin = mean, ymax = mean + sd)) +   geom_col(color = "black", fill = "grey50") +    geom_errorbar(width = 0.2) +   labs(     x = "Nation code",     y = "Reported landings (kt ± SD)"   ) +   scale_y_continuous(     expand = expansion(c(0,0.01)),     sec.axis = sec_axis(~ . *100 / sum(pnd$mean), name = "Percentage of total average landings")   ) +   theme_bw(base_size = 12) +   theme(axis.title.y.right = element_blank())  pgd <- salesnote_example_data %>%    left_join(     FDIRcodes$gearCodes %>%        mutate(gearCategory = sub(" ", "\n", gearCategory)),     by = join_by(gear_id == idGear)) %>%    group_by(gearCategory, year) %>%    reframe(value = sum(weight)/1e6) %>%   group_by(gearCategory) %>%    reframe(mean = mean(value), sd = sd(value)) %>%   tidyr::replace_na(list(sd = 0)) %>%    arrange(-mean) %>%    mutate(gear = factor(gearCategory, levels = gearCategory))   pg <- pgd %>%    ggplot(aes(x = gear, y = mean, ymin = mean, ymax = mean + sd)) +   geom_col(color = "black", fill = "grey50") +    geom_errorbar(width = 0.2) +   labs(     x = "Gear category",     y = "Reported landings (kt +/- SD)"   ) +   scale_y_continuous(     expand = expansion(c(0,0.01)),     sec.axis = sec_axis(~ . *100 / sum(pgd$mean), name = "Percentage of total average landings")   ) +   theme_bw(base_size = 12) +   theme(axis.title.y.left = element_blank())  cowplot::plot_grid(pn, pg, labels = "AUTO") tmp <- salesnote_example_data %>%    group_by(year, main_area) %>%    reframe(value = sum(weight)/1e6) %>%    left_join(ggOceanMaps::fdir_main_areas %>%                mutate(main_area = as.integer(main_area))) %>%    sf::st_as_sf()  p <- ggOceanMaps::basemap(tmp) +   geom_sf(data = tmp, aes(fill = value)) +   facet_wrap(~ year, ncol = 3) +   scale_fill_distiller(     palette = "Spectral", na.value = "white") +   labs(fill = "Catch (kt)") +   theme(legend.position = "bottom",         axis.title = element_blank(),          axis.text = element_blank()   )  reorder_layers(p) salesnote_example_data %>%    filter(     main_area %in% c(0:7, 10:18, 20:27, 30, 34:39, 50),     nation == "NOR"   ) %>%    group_by(year) %>%    reframe(value = sum(weight)/1e6) %>%    ggplot(aes(year, value)) +   geom_col(color = "black", fill = "grey50") +    labs(     x = "Year",     y = "Catch (kt)"   ) +   scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(c(0,0.01))) +   theme_bw(base_size = 12)

title: Download and Visualize Landings Data
text: Sales note data 2005, compiled Hans Stockhausen, stored Excel sheets IMR servers. work Bergen, can read files directly server readSluttseddelXLS() function. contrast, users Tromsø may find easier copy relevant folders (“sluttseddel_xls_ferdige_År”) hard disk due slow server access. Remember, data confidential, unlike ERS data vessels 15 meters. lines representing estimated catches overlap demonstrating results two data sources almost identical (Figure 4). readSluttseddelXLS() include latest years Excel sheets mess time writing, possible try opening adjusting years argument. Figure 4: Annual beaked redfish landings Norwegian fleet within ICES areas 1 2 according sales note data acquired using downloadLandings readSluttseddelXLS.
code: # Path to Stockhausen's sluttseddel Excel files to access data before 2005.  # If you want to use the server, check his emails for the correct path sluttseddel_excel_path <- ".../sluttseddel/sluttseddel_XLS_ferdige_År"  salesnote_xls_data <- RstoxUtils::readSluttseddelXLS(   species = "Snabeluer",   dataDir = sluttseddel_excel_path) salesnote_example_data %>%    filter(     main_area %in% c(0:7, 10:18, 20:27, 30, 34:39, 50),     nation == "NOR"   ) %>%    group_by(year) %>%    reframe(value = sum(weight)/1e6) %>%    mutate(source = "API") %>%    bind_rows(     salesnote_xls_data %>%        filter(         main_area %in% c(0:7, 10:18, 20:27, 30, 34:39, 50)       ) %>%        group_by(year) %>%        reframe(value = sum(weight)/1e6) %>%        mutate(source = "Excel")   ) %>%    ggplot(aes(year, value, color = source)) +   geom_path() +   labs(     x = "Year",     y = "Catch (kt)",     color = "Source"   ) +   scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(c(0,0.01))) +   theme_bw(base_size = 12)

title: Download and Visualize Landings Data
text: downloadLandings() function may sometimes return something like: Error downloadLandings(“Uer (vanlig)”) : Species code 2202 years found database. Even worked previously access server. happens likely (confirmed) due unstable connection institute’s intranet (least Tromsø). certain species exists connection intranet, try running command . still work, try splitting request smaller pieces using years argument.

what: Utility Functions for the Stox Project Within the Institute of Marine Research, Norway
title: Utility Functions for the Stox Project Within the Institute of Marine Research, Norway
text: Utility functions Stox Project. R package, updated 2025-09-12. package contains utility functions stock assessment data flow within Institute Marine Research (IMR). package two purposes: 1) function showcase developmental platform functions may included future releases Stox Project. 2) provide collection functions needed internal workflow Deep-sea species group IMR.

title: Utility Functions for the Stox Project Within the Institute of Marine Research, Norway
text: package requires RstoxData Stox project package function. packages can installed following links package using devtools package. RstoxUtils package can installed using devtools Stox project packages installed correctly. RstoxUtils uses multiple GIS packages developed R. may update (Packages -> Update -> Select -> Install updates R Studio). installation dependency fails, try installing packages manually (using RStudio install.packages).

title: Utility Functions for the Stox Project Within the Institute of Marine Research, Norway
text: See website, function reference specific articles use package: Sales note data ERS data Biotic data Note strata functions package moved RstoxStrata package entire IMR Biotic database can accessed using BioticExplorerServer package

title: Utility Functions for the Stox Project Within the Institute of Marine Research, Norway

R package #>   version 0.4.0, <https://github.com/DeepWaterIMR/RstoxUtils>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {RstoxUtils: Utility Functions for the Stox Project Within the Institute of Marine Research, Norway}, #>     author = {Mikko Vihtakari}, #>     year = {2025}, #>     note = {R package version 0.4.0}, #>     url = {https://github.com/DeepWaterIMR/RstoxUtils}, #>   }

Download Electronic Reporting System (ERS) catch data into a folder from the Norwegian Directorate of Fisheries webpage — downloadERS
text: dest File path character data downloaded . years integer vector years download. default downloads years. overwrite Either "yes", "" "force". "yes" option overwrites annual .zip files modified webpage compared existing files, "" returns error existing .zip files dest "force" downloads .zip files website overwriting existing files. fdir_url Character defining URL data downloaded . need modify source URL changed. case, send email maintainer address can updated.

title: Download sales note data for a species from the IMR database — downloadLandings
Download sales note data for a species from the IMR database — downloadLandings
text: species species identification name FDIRcodes$speciesCodes character. one species time allowed. years integer vector years download. NULL (default), years downloaded. Please note option can take long time lead huge datasets. returned_data character argument specifying type data returned. Use "sales notes" return original sales note data server, "summary" return summarized catches, "" return sales notes summarized catches list.

title: Download sales note data for a species from the IMR database — downloadLandings
text: Mikko Vihtakari

title: Download sales note data for a species from the IMR database — downloadLandings
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ downloadLandings("brugde") # Basking shark, all years downloadLandings("kveite", years = 2000:2001) # halibut, 2000-01 } # }

what: Extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks — extractERS
title: Extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks — extractERS
text: Extracts information detailed Norwegian fisheries logbook files downloaded using downloadERS function.

title: Extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks — extractERS
code: extractERS(   path,   species = NULL,   translate_header = TRUE,   method = "start",   language = "norwegian",   print.filename = FALSE,   ncores = parallel::detectCores() - 2 )

title: Extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks — extractERS
text: path Character argument defining path folder data located. can either entire folder case .zip files read single .zip file. species Character argument defining species. Species names can given Norwegian, English Latin depending language argument. Species names sampled FDIRcodes$speciesCodes. NULL returns species ERS data. translate_header Logical indicating whether translate original column names data selecting useful columns. FALSE, original columns returned without modifications. TRUE, columns modified. See Return details. method Character argument specifying method position, time depth extraction. Alternatives: "start" takes reported start values, "end" extracts reported end values "average" takes average start end values. language Character argument lower case specifying language species names returned data table. Alternatives: "norwegian", "english", "latin", species names acquired FDIRcodes$speciesCodes. print.filename Logical indicating whether file name printed console processing. Useful debugging. ncores Integer giving number cores used combining files. Speeds calculus.

title: Extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks — extractERS
text: translate_header = TRUE, data.table containing following columns: "year" year fishing event. "month" month fishing event. "id" identification number fishing event. "vesselName" name vessel. "radioCallSign" call signal vessel. "EEZ" reported exclusive economic zone fishing event. "ICESArea" reported FAO area fishing event. "FDIRMainArea" reported main area (hovedomraade) fishing event. "date" date time fishing event acquired based method argument. "lon" longitude coordinate fishing event decimal degrees acquired based method argument. "lat" latitude coordinate fishing event decimal degrees acquired based method argument. "depth" reported fishing depth meters acquired based method argument. "gear" gear name translated gearId based FDIRcodes$gearCodes. "gearGroup" reported gear group according Norwegian Directorate Fisheries. "gearCategory" gear category translated gearId based FDIRcodes$gearCodes. "gearSpecification" reported gear specification according Norwegian Directorate Fisheries. "gearMeshSize" reported gear mesh size. "gearAmount" reported gear amount (number hooks etc.). "gearMeshSize" reported issues gear. "fishTime" reported fishing time minutes. "fishDistance" reported fishing distance meters. "targetSp" target species based FAO definition: species highest weight catch. "catchSp" reported catch species based species, language subspecies arguments. Translated species ID (FANGSTART_NS FANGSTART_FAO) based FDIRcodes$speciesCodes. "weight" reported catch catchSp kilograms. Note NA catch species (Art - FDIR) filtered translate_header = TRUE. can include records fishing catch. translate_header = FALSE, data returned without filtering modifications Norwegian column names.

title: Extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks — extractERS
text: function extracts information Norwegian fisheries logbooks provided .zip format Norwegian Directorate Fisheries (FDIR) webpage. Use downloadERS function download data computer. Note time writing, FDIR provided ERS data > 15 m vessels due unclarities Norwegian Privacy Act. want access ERS data smaller vessels, use legacy function extractLogbook, reads confidential ERS data IMR servers.

title: Extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks — extractERS
text: Mikko Vihtakari (Institute Marine Research)

what: Legacy function to extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks from Excel files on the IMR server — extractLogbook
title: Legacy function to extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks from Excel files on the IMR server — extractLogbook
text: Extracts ERS information Excel files IMR server.

title: Legacy function to extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks from Excel files on the IMR server — extractLogbook
code: extractLogbook(   path,   species,   method = "start",   language = "norwegian",   subspecies = FALSE,   remove.sensitive = TRUE,   print.filename = FALSE )

title: Legacy function to extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks from Excel files on the IMR server — extractLogbook
text: path Character argument defining path folder data located species Character argument defining species. Species names can given Norwegian, English Latin. Species names sampled FDIRcodes$speciesCodes. method Character argument specifying method position, time depth extraction. Alternatives: "start" takes reported start values, "end" extracts reported end values "average" takes average start end values. language Character argument lower case specifying language species names returned data table. Alternatives: "norwegian", "english", "latin", species names acquired FDIRcodes$speciesCodes. subspecies Logical. NS codes (.e. species sub-categories) used translate species names? FALSE, FAO codes used leading actual species names. remove.sensitive Logical indicating whether function remove sensitive data fields. print.filename Logical indicating whether file name printed console processing. Useful debugging.

title: Legacy function to extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks from Excel files on the IMR server — extractLogbook
text: data.table containing following columns: "year" year fishing event. "month" month fishing event. "lon" longitude coordinate fishing event decimal degrees acquired based method argument. "lat" latitude coordinate fishing event decimal degrees acquired based method argument. "gearId" reported gear ID (REDSKAP_NS) .psv files "gear" gear name translated gearId based FDIRcodes$gearCodes. "gearCat" gear category translated gearId based FDIRcodes$gearCodes. "fishTime" reported fishing time. "effort" reported fishing effort (number hooks etc.) "dist" reported fishing distance meters. "depth" reported fishing depth meters acquired based method argument. "targetSpFAO" target species based FAO definition: species highest mass catch. "targetSpRep" target species reported fishermen. "species" reported catch species based species, language subspecies arguments. Translated species ID (FANGSTART_NS FANGSTART_FAO) based FDIRcodes$speciesCodes. "mass" reported catch species kilograms.

title: Legacy function to extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks from Excel files on the IMR server — extractLogbook
text: function extracts information Norwegian fisheries logbooks provided .psv format IMR server. Note data confidential protected Norwegian Privacy Act (personvernloven). Keep data server another safe place (cloud). send input data around email. remove.sensitive argument can used disconnect output confidential input data. output can distributed people signed confidentiality statement (students, ICES colleagues, etc.) also using email. data property Norwegian Directorate Fisheries consult plan publish parts dataset. Note structure logbook files confidential therefore function can distributed freely. data required function (send data email). many duplicate records logbook files server. function removes duplicates automatically, process takes time controlled. want sure data include, copy desired files another folder (safe place) run function folder.

title: Legacy function to extract ERS information from detailed Norwegian fisheries logbooks from Excel files on the IMR server — extractLogbook
text: Mikko Vihtakari (Institute Marine Research)

what: Read and process a NMD Biotic xml file for further use in the BioticExplorer — processBioticFile
title: Read and process a NMD Biotic xml file for further use in the BioticExplorer — processBioticFile
text: wrapper readXmlFile enable use BioticExplorer

title: Read and process a NMD Biotic xml file for further use in the BioticExplorer — processBioticFile
code: processBioticFile(   file,   lengthUnit = "cm",   weightUnit = "g",   removeEmpty = TRUE,   coreDataOnly = FALSE,   returnOriginal = TRUE,   dataTable = TRUE,   convertColumns = FALSE,   missionidPrefix = NULL )

title: Read and process a NMD Biotic xml file for further use in the BioticExplorer — processBioticFile
text: file character string specifying file path xml file. Accepts one file time. lengthUnit character string specifying unit length output. Alternatives: "mm", "cm" "m". weightUnit character string specifying unit weight output. Alternatives: "g" "kg". removeEmpty logical indicating whether empty columns removed output. option also influences "coreData" columns. coreDataOnly logical indicating whether important core columns picked data. See coreDataList list core columns data type. returnOriginal logical indicating whether original data ($mission $agedetermination) returned together combined data. dataTable logical indicating whether output returned data.tables instead data.frames. Setting TRUE speeds calculations using data (requires data.table syntax). convertColumns logical indicating whether column types converted. See link{convertColumnTypes}. Setting FALSE considerably speeds function, leads problems non-unicode characters. missionidPrefix prefix missionid identifier, separates cruises. Used processBioticFiles function several xml files put together. NULL (default) omits prefix. needed processBioticFile function.

title: Read and process a NMD Biotic xml file for further use in the BioticExplorer — processBioticFile
text: Returns list Biotic data $mission, $fishstation, $catchsample, $individual $agedetermination data frames. $stnall $indall data frames merged $fishstation $catchsample (former)  $fishstation, $catchsample, $individual $agedetermination (latter).

title: Read and process a NMD Biotic xml file for further use in the BioticExplorer — processBioticFile
text: Mikko Vihtakari (Institute Marine Research)

title: Read and process NMD Biotic xml files for further use in the BioticExplorer — processBioticFiles
text: files character string specifying file path xml file. Accepts one file time. lengthUnit character string specifying unit length output. Alternatives: "mm", "cm" "m". weightUnit character string specifying unit weight output. Alternatives: "g" "kg". removeEmpty logical indicating whether empty columns removed output. option also influences "coreData" columns. coreDataOnly logical indicating whether important core columns picked data. See coreDataList list core columns data type. returnOriginal logical indicating whether original data ($mission $agedetermination) returned together combined data. dataTable logical indicating whether output returned data.tables instead data.frames. Setting TRUE speeds calculations using data (requires data.table syntax). convertColumns logical indicating whether column types converted. See link{convertColumnTypes}. Setting FALSE considerably speeds function.

title: Read and process NMD Biotic xml files for further use in the BioticExplorer — processBioticFiles
text: Returns list Biotic data $mission, $fishstation, $catchsample, $individual $agedetermination data frames. $stnall $indall data frames merged $fishstation $catchsample (former)  $fishstation, $catchsample, $individual $agedetermination (latter).

title: Read and process NMD Biotic xml files for further use in the BioticExplorer — processBioticFiles
